definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to relieve boredom or melancholy/a diversion
to feel oppressed/to be depressed/to feel dejected
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
alcohol drunk to drown one's sorrows
erhua variant of 納悶|纳闷[na4 men4]

sentences.english: If you feel sad you can cry on my shoulder…
sentences.chinese: 悶悶悶，下載那首在我的肩膀哭泣都下不到。
而現在，他們悶不做聲了。

sentences.english: Have you even watch kids on a merry-go-round?
sentences.chinese: 你曾經注視過坐在旋轉木馬上的孩子悶嗎？

sentences.english: I feel adequate for taking care of Kylin.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得自己有足夠的能力照顧悶油瓶。

sentences.english: Food Suggestions: Enjoy with lamb dishes, soft cheeses and braised oxtail or pork in brown sauce.
sentences.chinese: 可與羊肉，軟乾酪，悶牛尾或紅燒肉一起享用。

sentences.english: Does plum rains season often have a kind to feel airtightly frowzily ?
sentences.chinese: 梅雨季節經常有一種悶不透氣的感覺？

sentences.english: Boil water, put in the spices and tea bags, simmer for 10 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 煮開水，把香料和茶包放進去，小火悶10分鐘。

sentences.english: You Wen facing mulberry Pu Doria , both sides makes into 0:0 stuffy sums finally.
sentences.chinese: 尤文面對桑普多利亞，雙方最終打成0比0的悶和。

sentences.english: Pour the water in and bring to a gentle simmer, stirring constantly.
sentences.chinese: 倒入水，用小火悶，不斷地翻炒幾下。

sentences.english: Kept at home with a wounded leg, I began to feel cooped up.
sentences.chinese: 我因爲腳受了傷而被迫呆在家裏，感到悶的慌。

sentences.english: Looks that their gratitude and grudges the reality performance, the day but is actually not stuffy.
sentences.chinese: 看着他們恩恩怨怨的現實表演，日子倒也不悶。

sentences.english: I’ve been cooped up in the house for the whole week.
sentences.chinese: 我已經在屋子裏悶了整整一個星期了。

definition: to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear

to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly

the five Liang of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Liang 前涼|前凉 (314-376), Later Liang 後涼|后凉 (386-403), Northern Liang 北涼|北凉 (398-439), Southern Liang 南涼|南凉 (397-414), Western Liang 西涼|西凉 (400-421)
confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out

to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
